reviewText: The title is a little misleading. I thought this was the highlights of the Steelers sb seasons which I already had on vhs. Actually it reviews the whole NFL in the years 1974, 75, 78, 79. Plus it has the highlights of all 4 sbs from the 70's. I like it.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Bo Duke--The Elvis Presley Fan "Jedi Master"
reviewText: I read the DVD cover in a store and knew what I would be getting when I bought it. Sure, it has highlights of the entire season for the 4 1970s Super Bowl years for the Steelers. It includes highlights of the entire year as to which teams did good and which didn't, not everyone will like it. But, I knew what I was getting in to when I finally made my mind up to buy it. For Steelers Fans too young to really remember each of the 4 1970s Super Bowls (Super Bowls IX in '74, X in '75, XIII in '78 and XIV in '79) it's good to see the entire season in perspective. Sure it would have been greater to concentrate on just the Pittsburgh Steelers, but, it's good to relive memories of the entire year to a point.
summary: I think this is great for Steelers Fans and NFL fans alike
Title: N/A

reviewText: The 4 Steelers Super Bowl highlights from NFL Films are included here. So, if you previously had them on VHS tapes, you can get them here on DVD. Though many have commented that they'll rather see full Steelers highlights in place of the whole NFL season highlights, I still find it enjoyable to watch stars throughout the NFL. I bought this at a low price, and feel it's worth the purchase just to have replay of football history on DVD. For Steelers fans or regular football fans.
Title: N/A

reviewText: GIVE ME A BREAK. WAKE UP NFL FILMS! PLEASE RELEASE A DVD SET WITH THE STEELERS SEASON HIGHLIGHT'S FOR THEIR SUPER BOWL SEASON'S. WE DON'T CARE ABOUT THE JET'S BAD SEASON IN 1975. WE WANT TO WATCH THE HIGHLIGHT'S OF THE STEELERS!
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you ever had any doubt they can fix a Super Bowl, here you go. Seattle beat the Fixburgh Stealers every way you can beat them: outcoached em, outhustled em, outgameplanned em, outexecuted em, etc. Everything but the refs of course. I could'nt bear to watch this thing but I'm sure this is the authorized NFL Films Propaganda Version: No examination of late flag after late flag after late flag. Bad call after bad call after amazingly bad call, and on and on. A travesty, and proof positive the NFL can fix any game it wants and get away with it.
Title: N/A
